page.title: 07FARMING IN HULCOTE & SALFORD
page.content: Farming in Hulcote and Salford has been a continuous process through our history. Fifteen farms are scattered in the area and the greatest part of the landis used to grow grain crops (corn and barley). The remainder of the land is used for oil seed rape and at times for green vegetables for human consumption and animal fodder in the form of silage. Cattle and sheep are raised for meat and dairy produce and poultry for wholesale egg production. Modern and time-saving machinery is used to harvest the grain crops. The combine harvester cuts and thrashes the corn in one unit disgorging the grain into a trailer ready for transportation. Stubble may be burned under controlled conditions but this is not advisable for safety reasons, so it must be ploughed back into the ground .
